security_controls.requirement: Identify and authenticate users. The information system uniquely identifies and authenticates organizational users (or processes acting on behalf of users).
security_controls.relevance: Mandates unique identification and authentication of users, which is fundamental to SSO and session management integrated with AD. Supports accountability and traceability for sessions.
security_controls.integration_tips: Map AD identities to application accounts, ensure unique user identifiers (e.g., UPN), enforce account linking processes and handle orphaned/disabled AD accounts. Log authentication events centrally.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect identity mapping, test authentication for multiple users, verify unique IDs in logs and ensure disabled AD accounts are denied access.

security_controls.requirement: Secure log-on procedures. Where required, users shall be provided with a secure log-on procedure.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies secure logon procedures for users, reinforcing requirement to secure AD SSO flows and session establishment practices. Relevant for corporate compliance.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document and enforce secure log-on procedures for SSO users, include MFA requirements if applicable, and train administrators on secure SSO configuration. Keep procedures updated with changes.
security_controls.verification_method: Review documented procedures, check enforcement of secure logon (MFA, session policies), and interview administrators about SSO process.

security_controls.requirement: Session management must protect session tokens (use secure cookies, HttpOnly, SameSite, and consider session rotation on privilege change).
security_controls.relevance: Directly addresses secure session token handling required after AD SSO authentication — prevents session theft and fixation. Applies to cookie and token-based sessions.
security_controls.integration_tips: Set Secure, HttpOnly, SameSite attributes on cookies, rotate session tokens on privilege changes and on re-authentication, and implement session timeout/idle expiration. Consider token binding where possible.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect cookie flags, perform session fixation and hijack tests, verify session rotation on privilege elevation and check session timeout behavior.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Role-based access control (RBAC) and user profile management

security_controls.requirement: Account management. The organization manages information system accounts, including establishing, activating, modifying, disabling, and removing accounts.
security_controls.relevance: Defines lifecycle management for accounts which is essential for RBAC and profile management. Ensures accounts and roles are provisioned and deprovisioned properly.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement automated provisioning/deprovisioning tied to AD/group membership, enforce role assignment workflows, and schedule periodic access reviews. Integrate with IAM for centralized control.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect account lifecycle procedures, test provisioning/deprovisioning scenarios, and review recent account change logs.

security_controls.requirement: Access to networks and network services shall be controlled.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates access control policy governing who can access resources — supports RBAC design and enforcement for application-level resources.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define RBAC policies aligned with business roles, document permissions for each role, and enforce via server-side checks. Ensure policies are part of the ISMS.
security_controls.verification_method: Review access control policies, role definitions, and sample enforcement in the application.

security_controls.requirement: Verify role-based access control is enforced server-side and default-deny is applied for all REST endpoints and UI actions.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies server-side enforcement and default-deny, preventing client-side bypass of RBAC. Highly relevant for API-driven profile and role management.
security_controls.integration_tips: Enforce RBAC in API gateway and application server, reject requests lacking required roles, implement least privilege, and perform automated tests for role boundaries.
security_controls.verification_method: Conduct authorization tests, attempt privilege escalation, and review access control checks across endpoints.

security_controls.requirement: Users shall follow secure use of authentication information and manage their credentials safely.
security_controls.relevance: Supports user responsibilities in managing profiles and credentials, helping prevent misuse of accounts and roles.
security_controls.integration_tips: Provide user guidance for credential handling, enforce password/MFA policies and log profile changes. Include role-change approval workflows.
security_controls.verification_method: Review user guidance materials, check enforcement of credential policies and audit of profile changes.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Responsive web dashboard for build/task monitoring

security_controls.requirement: Verify web application is resilient to XSS and that output encoding is used on all UI elements including dashboards and charts.
security_controls.relevance: Dashboards render dynamic content and charts — preventing XSS is essential to protect user sessions and data confidentiality on responsive interfaces.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply context-aware output encoding for all dynamic values in the dashboard, sanitize HTML, and use CSP headers. Use secure front-end frameworks and avoid dangerous innerHTML usage.
security_controls.verification_method: Perform XSS testing (automated and manual), review CSP headers and template encoding usage, and test across devices.

security_controls.requirement: Boundary protection. Monitor and control communications at external and internal boundaries of the information system.
security_controls.relevance: Dashboard communicates with APIs and internal services; boundary protections help ensure that only authorized traffic reaches monitoring endpoints.
security_controls.integration_tips: Deploy API gateways, WAFs and network segmentation for dashboard backend; ensure service-to-service communications are authenticated and encrypted.
security_controls.verification_method: Review network architecture, inspect WAF rules, and perform penetration testing of dashboard backends.

security_controls.requirement: Operating procedures should be documented for system operation including monitoring interfaces and dashboards.
security_controls.relevance: Operational documentation ensures dashboards are managed securely and monitored for anomalies, helping maintain secure operation across responsive UI changes.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document dashboard operations, access procedures and update processes. Include incident handling steps when dashboard shows anomalous activity.
security_controls.verification_method: Review documentation, run operational drills, and verify staff adherence to procedures.

security_controls.requirement: Ensure secure configuration of UI frameworks and third-party components used in dashboards (no insecure libraries).
security_controls.relevance: Responsive dashboards often use many UI libraries; insecure components introduce vulnerabilities. This control enforces secure dependency management.
security_controls.integration_tips: Maintain SBOM for front-end libs, scan for vulnerable dependencies, and update frameworks. Lock versions and use vetted CDN or self-hosted assets.
security_controls.verification_method: Run SCA on front-end dependencies, review SBOM, and verify upgrades/patches applied.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Real-time updates to clients using WebSockets or Server-Sent Events

security_controls.requirement: Ensure that WebSocket connections use TLS, validate origin headers, and implement proper authentication and authorization for message channels.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applicable: real-time channels must be encrypted and authenticated, and message channels authorized to prevent data leakage or unauthorized control messages.
security_controls.integration_tips: Terminate WebSocket over TLS (wss://), validate Origin and Sec-WebSocket-Protocol as applicable, attach token-based authentication and enforce channel-level ACLs server-side.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect TLS configuration, attempt unauthorized channel access, review token usage on handshake, and test Origin header validation.

security_controls.requirement: Transmission confidentiality and integrity. Protect the confidentiality and integrity of transmitted information.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates protection of data in transit — core to using WebSockets/SSE securely to protect real-time updates' confidentiality and integrity.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use TLS for all SSE/WebSocket endpoints, enable strong cipher suites, and ensure certificate management and pinning where appropriate.
security_controls.verification_method: Network capture analysis to verify encryption, validate cipher suites and certificate chain, and run MITM tests.

security_controls.requirement: Policy on the use of cryptographic controls shall be developed and implemented to protect information.
security_controls.relevance: Provides governance for using cryptography on real-time channels ensuring organization-level policies apply to WebSockets and SSE.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure cryptography policy mandates TLS for real-time channels, key lifecycle management, and acceptable algorithms. Document exceptions and review periodically.
security_controls.verification_method: Review cryptography policy, confirm enforcement in system settings, and audit TLS certs and key lifecycles.

security_controls.requirement: Real-time features must implement authorization checks server-side and validate messages to prevent injection and flooding attacks.
security_controls.relevance: Prevents misuse of real-time channels by enforcing server-side authorization and message validation to mitigate injection or flooding from clients.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement message schema validation, rate limiting per connection, and server-side ACL checks per subscription channel. Detect and disconnect abusive clients.
security_controls.verification_method: Simulate malformed messages and flooding, verify server rejects unauthorized messages and enforces quotas.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Interactive file browser with upload, drag-and-drop, previews, and versioning

security_controls.requirement: Validate and sanitize uploaded files. Enforce allow-listing of content types, scan for malware and store outside webroot with unpredictable names.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applies to file browser uploads: prevents arbitrary file execution, malware uploads, and content-type spoofing during drag-and-drop/previews.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement server-side MIME type checks and content inspection, store files outside webroot, generate secure filenames, and integrate AV scanning on upload.
security_controls.verification_method: Upload test files (malicious and benign), inspect storage location and filenames, and confirm AV scanning invoked.

security_controls.requirement: Malicious code protection. Employ anti-malware tools and scanning to detect and respond to malicious code.
security_controls.relevance: Supports malware scanning of uploaded artifacts and preview generation to prevent delivery of malicious content to users or preview services.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use sandboxed preview rendering, scan content on upload, and quarantine suspicious files. Ensure AV definitions are updated regularly.
security_controls.verification_method: Validate AV logs, test detection of known-malware test files, and inspect quarantine workflow.

security_controls.requirement: Information transfer policies should include controls for transfer of information and files including secure upload/download processes.
security_controls.relevance: Governance for file transfer processes ensures secure handling and documented controls for uploads and versioning.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define transfer policies for upload size limits, version retention, access permissions, and secure previewing. Include training for users on allowed content.
security_controls.verification_method: Review policies, confirm operational controls enforce policies, and test adherence with sample transfers.

security_controls.requirement: Implement secure file storage and access controls including versioning metadata and integrity checks for artifacts.
security_controls.relevance: Versioning and metadata integrity are directly relevant to maintaining artifact provenance and preventing tampering in the file browser.
security_controls.integration_tips: Store version metadata in the database with checksums for each version, restrict access via server-side ACLs and enable immutable storage for critical artifacts.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect version metadata records, verify checksum calculation, and test access control enforcement for different roles.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Support for large file uploads with progress reporting and resumable uploads

security_controls.requirement: For large uploads implement chunking, resumable upload protocols with integrity checks and server-side limits to prevent resource exhaustion.
security_controls.relevance: Directly addresses resumable/chunked uploads, ensuring integrity checks and preventing resource exhaustion during large file handling.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use established resumable protocols (e.g., tus), implement chunk integrity checks (hash per chunk + final verification), and perform authorized session checks per chunk.
security_controls.verification_method: Test resumable upload flows with interruptions, verify integrity checks, and confirm server enforces chunk/overall size limits.

security_controls.requirement: Denial of service protection. Protect against resource depletion via throttling and quotas.
security_controls.relevance: Large uploads are potential vectors for resource exhaustion; this control supports rate-limiting and quotas to mitigate DoS risks.
security_controls.integration_tips: Enforce per-user and global upload rate limits, quotas and concurrent upload limits; monitor upload resource usage for anomalies.
security_controls.verification_method: Simulate concurrent large uploads to validate throttling and observe system behavior under stress.

security_controls.requirement: Ensure that external facing services implementing large file handling are managed and patched and that vulnerabilities are tracked.
security_controls.relevance: Governance to ensure upload service components are patched and vulnerabilities in upload libraries/protocols are addressed.
security_controls.integration_tips: Include upload handlers in SCA/vulnerability scanning, track CVEs for libraries implementing resumable uploads and schedule patching windows.
security_controls.verification_method: Review vulnerability scans, patch records, and confirm components are on supported versions.

security_controls.requirement: Implement rate-limiting and quotas on upload APIs and provide resumable upload integrity via checksums (e.g., MD5/SHA2/ETag verification).
security_controls.relevance: Specifies checksums and quotas for upload integrity and abuse prevention — directly applicable to progress/resume features.
security_controls.integration_tips: Emit progress tokens securely, provide resumable API endpoints that accept chunk checksums and enforce quota checks before accepting chunks.
security_controls.verification_method: Verify server-side checksum validation, attempt to bypass quotas and confirm appropriate errors returned.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Web-based task creation, editing, deletion and bulk task operations

security_controls.requirement: Ensure all task CRUD operations enforce authorization server-side and validate input to prevent injection and business logic abuse.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures task operations cannot be performed by unauthorized users and prevents injection/business logic vulnerabilities during CRUD and bulk operations.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement server-side authorization checks per resource, validate/sanitize inputs, implement bulk-operation limits and confirm idempotency or safe rollbacks.
security_controls.verification_method: Perform privilege escalation tests, input fuzzing, and bulk operation abuse tests to ensure protections.

security_controls.requirement: Least privilege. The organization employs the principle of least privilege for users and processes.
security_controls.relevance: Applies to limiting which users can create/edit/delete tasks and minimizing permissions required for bulk operations.
security_controls.integration_tips: Design roles for minimal required permissions, require elevated approvals for destructive bulk operations, and log all bulk actions.
security_controls.verification_method: Review role assignments, attempt to execute operations with minimal privileges, and inspect logs for bulk actions.

security_controls.section: Securing application services on public networks
security_controls.requirement: Applications accessible from public networks shall be secured to protect data and services.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures web-based task operations exposed to networks implement necessary protections and secure coding practices.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply secure development lifecycle controls to task endpoints, enforce API authentication, and ensure proper exposure limits for bulk endpoints.
security_controls.verification_method: Code review of task APIs, penetration testing and review of network exposure.

security_controls.requirement: Implement strong input validation and parameterized queries for APIs that modify tasks (no direct object reference exposure).
security_controls.relevance: Prevents injection via task inputs and mitigates insecure direct object reference during task manipulation.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use parameterized queries/ORMs, validate IDs and ownership server-side, and avoid exposing raw database keys in UI.
security_controls.verification_method: Conduct injection tests, IDOR checks, and review database access patterns for task endpoints.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Task queue management, prioritization and SLURM-based job submission API

security_controls.requirement: Information security architecture. Develop and maintain an architecture for the system including interfaces to external schedulers and resource managers.
security_controls.relevance: Requires documenting the architecture and interfaces to SLURM/job schedulers to ensure secure design of the submission API and prioritization logic.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document API-to-SLURM interactions, threat model scheduler interfaces, and include secure authentication/authorization for submission endpoints.
security_controls.verification_method: Review architecture docs, interface diagrams, and threat model outputs for SLURM integration.

security_controls.requirement: Ensure job submission APIs enforce authorization, quotas, priority controls and validate job parameters to prevent privilege escalation and resource abuse.
security_controls.relevance: Directly targets submission API behavior ensuring it enforces quotas/priorities and validates job parameters to prevent abuse.
security_controls.integration_tips: Enforce per-user/group quotas, validate SLURM job parameters server-side, implement priority rules and require admin approval for high-priority jobs.
security_controls.verification_method: Attempt to submit jobs with escalated priorities, invalid parameters and observe enforcement of quotas and validation.

security_controls.requirement: Change management procedures shall be followed for system changes including job scheduling interfaces.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures changes to scheduling and priority logic are controlled and reviewed to prevent accidental privilege changes or scheduling issues.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply change control to SLURM integration components, include security review for changes to job priorities and scheduling policies.
security_controls.verification_method: Review change logs, approvals and test results for updates to scheduling interfaces.

security_controls.requirement: Contingency plan. Develop contingency plans for essential business functions including job processing and queuing.
security_controls.relevance: Applicable to ensuring queue management has contingency plans if scheduler or submission APIs fail, preserving availability of job processing.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define fallback processing, queue retries, degraded mode behavior and document SLA impacts for scheduler outages.
security_controls.verification_method: Run failure scenarios for scheduler unavailability and confirm contingency process works as designed.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Background worker service for HPC communication and job lifecycle management

security_controls.requirement: Cryptographic protection. The system protects the confidentiality and integrity of remote communications.
security_controls.relevance: Background worker communicates with HPC resources; protecting the confidentiality and integrity of these communications is essential.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use mutually authenticated TLS for worker-to-HPC communications, ensure keys/certs are managed, and restrict endpoints to known hosts.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect TLS configurations, validate mutual authentication, and capture traffic to confirm encryption.

security_controls.requirement: Background services should authenticate to backend systems using managed credentials and use encrypted channels; job lifecycle state changes must be logged and validated.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies use of managed credentials and logging for lifecycle events — directly applicable to worker services managing jobs.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use vault-managed credentials for workers, rotate secrets, implement authenticated service accounts and log all lifecycle events with context.
security_controls.verification_method: Review credential usage, test secret rotation, and inspect audit logs for job lifecycle events.

security_controls.requirement: Access to systems and services shall be restricted based on business and security requirements.
security_controls.relevance: Applies to limiting worker service access to only required HPC resources and controlling permissions to execute lifecycle operations.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define least privilege roles for worker service accounts, use network segmentation to limit access, and enforce ACLs on HPC endpoints.
security_controls.verification_method: Review service account permissions, run access scans and attempt unauthorized operations from worker context.

security_controls.requirement: Audit generation. The information system can produce audit records for defined events including job lifecycle changes.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures lifecycle events generated by workers are auditable for troubleshooting and compliance.
security_controls.integration_tips: Log job state transitions with timestamps, user/service identity and relevant metadata; centralize logs and secure them.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect audit log contents for job lifecycle events and verify log integrity protection.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: REST API endpoints for submitting and managing jobs via SLURM

security_controls.requirement: Use strong authentication and authorization for API endpoints; protect APIs with TLS and ensure proper rate-limiting and input validation.
security_controls.relevance: Directly relevant to REST endpoints for SLURM: enforce TLS, authentication and input validation to prevent misuse and injection.
security_controls.integration_tips: Require token-based auth (OAuth2/JWT), validate all job submission parameters server-side, and enforce TLS with proper cert management.
security_controls.verification_method: Test auth enforcement, validate TLS and attempt injection or malformed parameter submissions.

security_controls.requirement: Access enforcement. The information system enforces access restrictions for users and processes to objects.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates enforcement of access controls for job resources and management operations via REST APIs.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply server-side ACL checks for job resources, implement role checks for job management APIs and log enforcement decisions.
security_controls.verification_method: Attempt unauthorized access and verify API rejects requests; review enforcement logs.

security_controls.requirement: Security requirements of information systems shall be specified and implemented for APIs including testing.
security_controls.relevance: Requires documenting and testing security requirements for SLURM submission APIs as part of secure development lifecycle.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define API security requirements, incorporate automated tests for auth/validation, and include these in CI pipelines.
security_controls.verification_method: Review requirements artifacts and CI test results validating API security.

security_controls.requirement: Information input validation. The system checks the validity of inputs to interfaces.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates input validation for API parameters to prevent injection, malformed job definitions or resource abuse via REST endpoints.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define strict schemas for job submission payloads, validate ranges/values, and perform type and semantic validation before forwarding to SLURM.
security_controls.verification_method: Run fuzzing and schema-based tests against submission endpoints and verify rejection of invalid inputs.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Web API for programming FPGAs (bitfile deployment) and UART integration

security_controls.requirement: APIs that control hardware must enforce strict authentication, authorization and non-repudiation; ensure integrity of bitfiles and secure transport to device.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applicable: hardware programming APIs are high-risk and must ensure bitfile integrity, strong auth and non-repudiation to avoid malicious firmware deployment.
security_controls.integration_tips: Sign bitfiles and verify signatures before deployment, require elevated/role-based approval for programming operations, and use secure channels (mutual TLS) to device endpoints.
security_controls.verification_method: Verify signature verification, simulate unauthorized programming attempts, and audit bitfile deployment logs.

security_controls.requirement: Baseline configuration. Establish and maintain baseline configurations and inventories for hardware and firmware.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates maintaining baselines for FPGA firmware and hardware configuration, which supports safe deployments and rollback capabilities.
security_controls.integration_tips: Maintain inventory of FPGA devices and bitfile versions, enforce baseline checks before deployment, and enable rollback to known-good bitfiles.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect inventory, baseline configuration records and test rollbacks.

security_controls.section: Removal or adjustment of access rights
security_controls.requirement: Access rights shall be reviewed when job roles change, especially for hardware controllers.
security_controls.relevance: Applies to ensuring only authorized personnel can initiate FPGA programming and access UART interfaces; access must be adjusted with role changes.
security_controls.integration_tips: Require approval workflows and periodic reviews for access to FPGA programming functions; strip rights when roles change.
security_controls.verification_method: Review access control lists and recent access entitlement changes for FPGA controllers.

security_controls.requirement: Media sanitization and protection for removable media and firmware images.
security_controls.relevance: Applies to protection of firmware/bitfile artifacts stored or transported to devices; ensures proper media handling and sanitization if needed.
security_controls.integration_tips: Protect bitfile storage with encryption, control access, and ensure removal/sanitization processes for devices before redeployment.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect storage protections, encryption status, and sanitization logs for device media.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Live log streaming and log storage with export (PDF/CSV/TXT)

security_controls.requirement: Audit events. Determine and document auditable events including system and user actions and ensure logs record sufficient information.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies the need to capture relevant events for streaming and storage, ensuring exports contain required audit details for compliance/troubleshooting.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define auditable events for streaming/export, include timestamps/user context, and ensure exports redact or exclude sensitive data as required.
security_controls.verification_method: Review log schema, check that exports contain required fields, and validate completeness via sample forensic scenarios.

security_controls.requirement: Ensure logs are captured securely, transmitted with integrity protection, and that streaming of logs uses authenticated channels and protects sensitive content.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applies to live log streaming — requires secure transport, authentication, and protection of sensitive log content during streaming and storage.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use authenticated, encrypted channels for log streaming (TLS), classify and redact sensitive log fields before export, and limit export formats to approved tools/processes.
security_controls.verification_method: Capture streaming traffic to verify encryption, audit logs for integrity metadata, and test export redaction rules.

security_controls.requirement: Event logs recording user activities, exceptions and information security events shall be produced and retained.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates log retention and production of events for auditing, applying to stored logs and exported outputs.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define retention policies for logs, secure storage with access controls, and include retention periods meeting regulatory/compliance needs.
security_controls.verification_method: Review retention policy and verify logs older/within expected retention are available and secured.

security_controls.requirement: Protection of audit information. Protect audit records from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures log storage and exports are protected from tampering and unauthorized access, crucial for forensic integrity.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement WORM or write-protected storage for critical logs, enforce strict ACLs, and use checksums/digital signatures on archived logs.
security_controls.verification_method: Attempt unauthorized modifications in test environment, verify logs include integrity checks and access controls.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: GitHub OAuth integration, repo/branch selection UI and webhook-driven automated builds

security_controls.requirement: Verify that authentication mechanisms use secure, industry standard protocols (e.g., SAML, OAuth2, OpenID Connect) for single sign-on and federation.
security_controls.relevance: Directly relevant to GitHub OAuth integration: requires using OAuth2 securely for authorization flows and token handling.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use standard OAuth flows with state parameter, validate token scopes, store tokens securely in vaults, and restrict token lifetime where possible.
security_controls.verification_method: Review OAuth app settings, test authorization code flow, and inspect token scopes and revocation handling.

security_controls.requirement: External systems and services shall be documented and security controls validated when integrating third-party services.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates validation and documentation when integrating third-party services such as GitHub and Webhooks, ensuring risks are assessed.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document the GitHub integration, validate webhook security (signature verification), and include third-party risks in supplier analysis.
security_controls.verification_method: Review integration documentation, validate webhook signatures and test reaction to tampered webhooks.

security_controls.section: Information security policy for supplier relationships
security_controls.requirement: Information security requirements for mitigating risks from supplier access, including third-party code repositories, shall be established.
security_controls.relevance: Governance control for third-party access like GitHub, ensuring contractual and security requirements for repo access and webhooks.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure contracts/agreements include security clauses, restrict repo access to least privilege, and monitor third-party events.
security_controls.verification_method: Review supplier agreements and access lists for GitHub integrations and confirm monitoring is enabled.

security_controls.requirement: Validate and authorize incoming webhook requests (verify signatures), and ensure build triggers are authenticated and validated before executing actions.
security_controls.relevance: Specifically addresses webhook security for automated builds: verify signatures and authenticate triggers to prevent malicious build triggers.
security_controls.integration_tips: Validate X-Hub-Signature/X-Hub-Signature-256 or equivalent for webhook payloads, register webhook secrets, and require explicit mapping from repo to allowed actions.
security_controls.verification_method: Send forged webhook payloads and confirm they are rejected; inspect webhook handling logs for signature validation.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Linking builds to specific commits and PRs with commit metadata display

security_controls.requirement: System component inventory. Track and maintain information on components including versions and changes.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates tracking of components/versions — mapping to commits and PRs is core to maintaining provenance and inventory for builds.
security_controls.integration_tips: Store commit SHA, author and PR metadata with build records; include mechanisms to verify commit integrity and maintain a searchable inventory.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect inventory records and confirm builds link to correct commit SHAs and metadata.

security_controls.requirement: Capture sufficient metadata for build provenance (commit SHA, author, timestamp) and ensure integrity of links between builds and source control.
security_controls.relevance: Directly requires capture and integrity protection of commit metadata associated with builds to prevent tampering or mismatches.
security_controls.integration_tips: Record immutable metadata for each build, sign build records or use checksums linking artifacts to commits, and prevent edit of provenance information in UI.
security_controls.verification_method: Verify build records’ metadata signatures/checksums and attempt to tamper with metadata to test detection.

security_controls.requirement: Control changes to systems and maintain records of changes including version details and responsible parties.
security_controls.relevance: Supports change control and recording of commits/PRs associated with builds to maintain accountability and traceability.
security_controls.integration_tips: Include commit/PR linkage in change control records and ensure responsible parties are logged for each build and deployment.
security_controls.verification_method: Review change logs linking builds to commits and confirm responsible parties are recorded.

security_controls.requirement: Software, firmware, and information integrity checks to ensure authenticity and integrity.
security_controls.relevance: Applies to verifying integrity of artifacts linked to commits; ensures artifacts correspond to authentic source control data.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use signed commits/tags where possible, verify signatures or checksums of source and built artifacts, and store integrity evidence with builds.
security_controls.verification_method: Validate artifact checksums against recorded commit data and verify signature chains if used.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: In-app, email and optional browser push notifications with user preferences

security_controls.section: Privacy and protection of personal data
security_controls.requirement: Ensure compliance with data protection laws and user preferences for notifications and communications.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures notification channels respect user privacy preferences and compliance obligations (e.g., opt-in for certain notifications).
security_controls.integration_tips: Store and enforce user preferences, avoid including sensitive data in notifications, and ensure opt-in/opt-out mechanisms are auditable.
security_controls.verification_method: Review preference storage, test opt-out flows, and perform privacy impact assessment for notification content.

security_controls.requirement: Information security architecture. Plan for privacy and notification channels in system architecture.
security_controls.relevance: Encourages inclusion of notification channel security in architecture planning to ensure correct protections across in-app/email/push.
security_controls.integration_tips: Architect separate channels with appropriate protections (TLS for push, secure SMTP/TLS for email), and centralize preference evaluation before dispatch.
security_controls.verification_method: Review architecture artifacts and ensure channel protections are implemented and documented.

security_controls.requirement: Protect personal data in notifications and ensure opt-in/opt-out preferences are persisted and enforced.
security_controls.relevance: Specifically addresses protecting personal data in notifications and enforcement of user preferences required for notifications.
security_controls.integration_tips: Avoid leaking PII in push/email subject lines, ensure templates redact sensitive info and enforce preference checks server-side prior to sending.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect sent notification samples for PII leakage and test that opt-outs prevent delivery.

security_controls.requirement: Permitted actions without identification or authentication. The system restricts actions that unauthenticated users can perform, including receiving or controlling notifications.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures that control over notification preferences or delivery requires appropriate authentication to prevent abuse or unwanted changes.
security_controls.integration_tips: Require authentication for preference management and for changing delivery endpoints, and verify ownership before altering notification targets.
security_controls.verification_method: Attempt unauthorized preference changes and confirm system blocks them.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Reporting and analytics dashboard with charts, trends and exportable reports

security_controls.requirement: Records shall be protected from loss, destruction and falsification and shall be retained as required.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures reports and analytics artifacts are protected, retained properly, and protected from tampering.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply role-based access to reports, protect report exports, and implement integrity checks and retention aligned with policy.
security_controls.verification_method: Review retention and protection configurations and attempt to alter stored reports.

security_controls.requirement: Audit review, analysis, and reporting. Regularly review and analyze audit records for indications of inappropriate activity.
security_controls.relevance: Relevant to analytics pipelines that could aggregate sensitive operational/audit data; ensures analysis is accurate and secure.
security_controls.integration_tips: Control access to analytics data, anonymize/summarize where necessary, and audit analysts' access to raw datasets.
security_controls.verification_method: Review audit of analytics access and validate anonymization/aggregation safeguards.

security_controls.requirement: Ensure analytics pipelines protect confidentiality of sensitive data, apply aggregation/anonymization where needed and secure export functions.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applies by requiring anonymization/aggregation and secure exports to prevent leakage of sensitive information in reports.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply field-level redaction, role-based report access, and encrypt exported reports at rest and in transit.
security_controls.verification_method: Review sample exports for PII, test access controls, and verify export encryption.

security_controls.requirement: Information shall be classified to indicate the value, sensitivity and criticality of the information assets.
security_controls.relevance: Classifying data informs what can be displayed in analytics and what must be masked or aggregated.
security_controls.integration_tips: Classify datasets used for analytics and enforce controls based on classification for display and export.
security_controls.verification_method: Check classification labels for datasets and sample enforcement in analytics outputs.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Build artifact storage, download, retention policies and artifact versioning

security_controls.requirement: Implement secure file storage and access controls including versioning metadata and integrity checks for artifacts.
security_controls.relevance: Directly relevant to artifact storage — mandates secure storage, version metadata, and integrity checks for download/retention.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use encrypted storage, maintain immutable version metadata and checksums, apply ACLs for downloads and automate retention/expiry policies.
security_controls.verification_method: Attempt to access artifacts without authorization, verify checksums, and inspect retention purge processes.

security_controls.requirement: Media storage. Protect stored information system media; sanitize, store and transport media securely.
security_controls.relevance: Applies to artifact media protection, storage controls and secure transport for downloads.
security_controls.integration_tips: Encrypt artifacts at rest and in transit, control export interfaces, and implement physical protections for offline media.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect encryption at rest, transport security for downloads, and attempt unauthorized media retrieval.

security_controls.requirement: Security controls for equipment and storage to prevent unauthorized access to information.
security_controls.relevance: Supports physical/environmental protections that may apply to artifact storage hardware.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure data centers and storage locations meet physical security standards and include artifact storage in maintenance plans.
security_controls.verification_method: Review physical security controls and maintenance logs for storage equipment.

security_controls.requirement: Information system backup. Conduct backups of user-level and system-level information to support recovery.
security_controls.relevance: Backup supports retention and recovery for artifacts and version history in case of data loss.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement redundant backups for artifact storage, protect backups, and test restore procedures regularly.
security_controls.verification_method: Test restore of artifact versions from backups and verify integrity.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Audit trail and task history for compliance and troubleshooting

security_controls.requirement: Audit events. Determine and document auditable events including system and user actions and ensure logs record sufficient information.
security_controls.relevance: Directly requires determining auditable events which is foundational for audit trails and task history capture.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define events to capture (task create/update/delete, executor actions), include user/service identity, timestamps and context in logs.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect log entries for required event fields and perform sample investigations to validate sufficiency.

security_controls.requirement: Ensure audit trails are tamper-evident, searchable and contain sufficient context for forensics and compliance.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures that audit trails for tasks are protected against tampering and usable for compliance investigations.
security_controls.integration_tips: Store logs in an append-only/separately controlled system, index for search and enforce retention and access controls.
security_controls.verification_method: Attempt log tampering in a controlled test, verify tamper detection and searchability.

security_controls.requirement: Administrator and operator activities shall be logged and monitored to support investigations and accountability.
security_controls.relevance: Applies to logging of admin/operator actions in task histories for accountability and compliance.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure admin actions on tasks are separately logged with elevated detail and reviewed periodically.
security_controls.verification_method: Review admin logs and confirm entries include necessary context for each action.

security_controls.requirement: Audit review, analysis, and reporting. Regularly review and analyze audit records for indications of inappropriate activity.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates regular review of audit trails to detect misuse and support troubleshooting of task history issues.
security_controls.integration_tips: Build alerting around suspicious activity patterns, schedule periodic log reviews and integrate SIEM for analysis.
security_controls.verification_method: Verify review schedules, alert rules, and SIEM correlation outputs for task-related events.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Web-based administration panel for system configuration and health checks

security_controls.requirement: Administrative interfaces must be protected with multi-factor authentication, strict RBAC, and audited access.
security_controls.relevance: Administration panel requires strong protections (MFA/RBAC) to prevent unauthorized configuration changes and maintain security.
security_controls.integration_tips: Require MFA for admin accounts, enforce least-privilege roles for admin functions and log all admin activity with alerts for unusual access.
security_controls.verification_method: Attempt admin access without MFA, test role boundaries and review admin audit logs.

security_controls.requirement: Remote access. The organization authorizes, monitors, and controls remote access methods including administrative interfaces.
security_controls.relevance: Controls remote admin access to the panel ensuring authorized, monitored connectivity and secure methods.
security_controls.integration_tips: Restrict remote admin access via VPN/jump hosts, apply network ACLs and monitor connections to admin endpoints.
security_controls.verification_method: Review remote access controls and attempt remote admin access from unauthorized networks.

security_controls.requirement: Where password management systems are used, secure procedures shall be implemented.
security_controls.relevance: Supports secure credential management for admin accounts and password usage in admin panel.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use enterprise password managers for admin credentials, require rotation and protect secrets with vaults and MFA.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect password management usage and policies for admin accounts.

security_controls.requirement: Information system monitoring. The system monitors events and notifications for indications of attack or compromise.
security_controls.relevance: Health checks and monitoring exposed via admin panel must be monitored for indications of misuse or attacks.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure health endpoints require auth, return limited info to callers, and feed health metrics into monitoring/alerting systems.
security_controls.verification_method: Review health endpoint authentication, check monitoring integrations, and test alert triggers.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Containerized deployment (Docker) and automated provisioning/upgrades via Ansible

security_controls.requirement: Baseline configuration. Develop and maintain baseline configurations and inventories for systems and components, including container images.
security_controls.relevance: Requires baselining container images and inventories to ensure secure configurations for Docker and automated provisioning.
security_controls.integration_tips: Maintain a catalog of approved container images, define hardened base images, and enforce image signing and provenance checks in CI/CD.
security_controls.verification_method: Review image inventory, baseline configs and confirm image promotion/pipeline enforces sign/scan steps.

security_controls.requirement: Ensure container images are built from trusted sources, scanned for vulnerabilities, and runtime configurations minimize privileges.
security_controls.relevance: Directly addresses secure container build, scanning and runtime hardening — critical for Docker-based deployment.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use image scanning in build pipeline, enforce non-root containers, restrict capabilities and use resource limits and read-only filesystems.
security_controls.verification_method: Check CI/CD pipeline scans, inspect running container configs for dropped capabilities and non-root execution.

security_controls.requirement: Ensure that vulnerabilities in software and containers are tracked and remediated in a timely manner.
security_controls.relevance: Governs the vulnerability management processes for container images and automation tooling like Ansible.
security_controls.integration_tips: Integrate SCA and image CVE scanning, track vulnerabilities in a ticketing system and schedule patching for base images and Ansible modules.
security_controls.verification_method: Review vulnerability tracker, patch timelines and evidence of remediated container issues.

security_controls.requirement: Security engineering principles shall be integrated into system acquisition and development, including automation tooling.
security_controls.relevance: Promotes secure engineering for provisioning tools and deployment pipelines (Ansible), ensuring security is built into automation.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply secure coding and parameterize secrets in Ansible, validate playbooks for safe operations and restrict playbook access.
security_controls.verification_method: Review playbook repository controls, code reviews of provisioning scripts and test runs in staging.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Database backup/restore via web interface and health endpoints for monitoring

security_controls.requirement: Information system backup. Conduct backups of user-level and system-level information to support recovery.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applies to backup/restore requirements: ensures backups are performed and usable to restore databases when needed.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement automated backups, test restores regularly, encrypt backups and restrict access to the restore functionality via RBAC and MFA.
security_controls.verification_method: Run restore exercises and review backup logs and encryption status.

security_controls.requirement: Health endpoints and admin interfaces should require authentication, return minimal information and be monitored; backup/restore operations should be access-controlled and logged.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies that backup/restore via web UI must be access-controlled, audited, and health endpoints limited in information exposure.
security_controls.integration_tips: Require MFA for restore operations, log all restore actions, limit health endpoint verbosity and monitor for anomalous health queries.
security_controls.verification_method: Test unauthorized restore attempts, review health endpoint responses and check restore logs.

security_controls.chapter: Information security aspects of business continuity management
security_controls.requirement: Information security continuity should be embedded in business continuity management and include backup and restoration procedures.
security_controls.relevance: Requires embedding backup/restore operations into continuity plans, including security aspects for web-initiated restores.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document backup/restore procedures in BCP, define roles for web-initiated restores and test as part of continuity exercises.
security_controls.verification_method: Review BCP documents and results from continuity tests including web-initiated restore workflows.

security_controls.requirement: Time stamps. Use internal system clocks to provide reliable time stamps for audit records (important for backups/restores logging).
security_controls.relevance: Ensures that backup/restore auditing includes reliable timestamps for forensic and recovery ordering.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use synchronized NTP sources and include verifiable timestamps in backup metadata and restore logs.
security_controls.verification_method: Check timestamp consistency in backup logs and restore records across systems.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Session security, secure logout and protection against common web threats (CSRF/XSS/Injection)

security_controls.requirement: Session management must protect session tokens (use secure cookies, HttpOnly, SameSite, and consider session rotation on privilege change).
security_controls.relevance: Addresses session token protection and rotation, central to secure logout and prevention of session-related attacks.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement secure cookie attributes, revoke server-side sessions on logout, rotate tokens on privilege change and enforce idle/absolute timeouts.
security_controls.verification_method: Test cookie flags, session rotation and logout behavior; attempt session reuse after logout.

security_controls.requirement: Verify web application is resilient to XSS and that output encoding is used on all UI elements including dashboards and charts.
security_controls.relevance: XSS mitigation reduces risk of session token exfiltration and script-based attacks against session state.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use output encoding, CSP, and escape user-supplied content; sanitize HTML inputs and limit inline scripts.
security_controls.verification_method: Perform XSS testing and CSP analysis on key pages and verify absence of unsafe inline code.

security_controls.requirement: Authenticator management. Policies for secure management of authentication mechanisms including session termination and reuse prevention.
security_controls.relevance: Provides guidance on management of authenticators and termination semantics, useful for secure logout and session lifecycle policies.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define authenticator/credential lifecycle policies, enforce session termination on logout and protect reuse with nonce/session identifiers.
security_controls.verification_method: Audit authenticator policies and test termination and reuse prevention mechanisms.

security_controls.requirement: Implement strong input validation and parameterized queries for APIs that modify tasks (no direct object reference exposure).
security_controls.relevance: Input validation and parameterized queries help prevent injection flaws which could compromise session or application integrity.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply input validation across endpoints, use parameterized DB queries/ORM and avoid concatenation of user input into commands.
security_controls.verification_method: Conduct injection testing (SQL/command injection) and review query construction patterns.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Secrets management and secure storage of credentials (HPC, GitHub, FPGA controllers)

security_controls.requirement: Media sanitization and protection for removable media and firmware images.
security_controls.relevance: Applies to protecting secret-bearing media and ensuring credentials and firmware images are protected from unauthorized retrieval.
security_controls.integration_tips: Treat credential stores as sensitive media, encrypt them at rest and ease secure deletion on rotation or decommission.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect storage encryption and sanitation procedures for credential-bearing media.

security_controls.requirement: Secrets (API keys, credentials) must be stored encrypted, not in source code, and access controlled (use secret vaults and rotation).
security_controls.relevance: Directly relevant: requires usage of secret vaults, encryption at rest and rotation policies for HPC, GitHub tokens and device creds.
security_controls.integration_tips: Integrate HashiCorp Vault or cloud KMS, avoid embedding secrets in images, enforce least privilege access to secrets and automated rotation.
security_controls.verification_method: Review secret storage implementation, check for hard-coded secrets and test rotation workflows.

security_controls.requirement: Cryptographic protection. The system protects the confidentiality and integrity of remote communications.
security_controls.relevance: Supports secure transport of credentials to HPC controllers and FPGA devices using cryptographic protection.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use TLS/mTLS for credential transmission, protect keys used for encryption, and apply secure key management processes.
security_controls.verification_method: Validate crypto use in transit and encryption key management records.

security_controls.requirement: Policy on the use of cryptographic controls shall be developed and implemented to protect information.
security_controls.relevance: Governance requiring cryptographic controls underpin secret storage and usage policies.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure organization cryptography policy mandates vault use, key rotation, and acceptable algorithms for credential protection.
security_controls.verification_method: Review cryptography policy and evidence of enforcement for secret management.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Access controls and isolation for FPGA hardware and HPC resources

security_controls.requirement: Information flow enforcement. The system enforces approved authorizations for controlling information flow within the system and between interconnected systems.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures that access and information flow to FPGA/HPC devices are restricted to approved flows, preventing unauthorized lateral movement or data exfiltration.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement network segmentation, firewall rules, and strict ACLs to limit flows to device management endpoints and data paths.
security_controls.verification_method: Perform network flow analysis and attempt unauthorized flows to verify enforcement.

security_controls.requirement: Physical and logical isolation must be applied to hardware like FPGAs and HPC resources; ensure RBAC and policy enforcement for device access.
security_controls.relevance: Directly calls for physical and logical isolation, role-based access and policy enforcement for hardware resources.
security_controls.integration_tips: Segregate hardware on dedicated networks/VLANs, enforce RBAC for device access and apply additional controls such as jump hosts for admin operations.
security_controls.verification_method: Verify VLAN segmentation, test access via jump hosts and review RBAC enforcement logs for device access.

security_controls.requirement: Physical security perimeters shall be defined and used to protect information processing facilities and hardware.
security_controls.relevance: Applicable where FPGA/HPC hardware are physically located — protects against unauthorized physical access to devices.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure devices are located in controlled data centers, restrict physical access, and monitor for unauthorized presence.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect physical access controls, badges, CCTV logs and facility policies.

security_controls.requirement: Baseline configuration. Develop and maintain baseline configurations including device-level access policies.
security_controls.relevance: Maintaining baseline device configs helps detect unauthorized changes and ensures isolation settings remain consistent.
security_controls.integration_tips: Capture baseline configs for FPGA/HPC nodes and monitor for deviations; enforce configuration drift remediation.
security_controls.verification_method: Compare running configs to baselines and report drift for remediation.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Performance/scalability requirements for concurrent builds and real-time updates

security_controls.requirement: Real-time features must implement authorization checks server-side and validate messages to prevent injection and flooding attacks.
security_controls.relevance: Performance and concurrency must be balanced with security controls to prevent flooding or misuse of real-time updates and builds.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement capacity planning, rate-limiting, connection limits and validate load handling to ensure security controls degrade gracefully under high load.
security_controls.verification_method: Perform load and stress tests while monitoring enforcement of authorization and message validation under load.

security_controls.requirement: Denial of service protection. Protect against resource depletion via throttling and quotas.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies protective measures against DoS which are critical for meeting scalability and availability requirements.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply autoscaling policies with resource quotas, implement throttles and queueing, and design graceful degradation for non-critical features.
security_controls.verification_method: Conduct DoS/traffic surge tests and validate throttling and recovery mechanisms.

security_controls.requirement: Operating procedures should be documented for system operation including monitoring interfaces and dashboards.
security_controls.relevance: Capacity planning and operational responses should be documented to maintain availability and scalability securely.
security_controls.integration_tips: Create capacity/runbooks, include scaling thresholds and incident response steps and coordinate with security monitoring.
security_controls.verification_method: Review capacity plans and runbooks and test scaling procedures during drills.

security_controls.requirement: System recovery and reconstitution. Ensure systems can recover from disruptions and scale to meet demand.
security_controls.relevance: Addresses recovery/scalability planning to restore service levels after disruption and sustain concurrent builds.
security_controls.integration_tips: Design recovery procedures, warm standby capacity, and validate restore and scaling as part of contingency tests.
security_controls.verification_method: Run recovery tests and measure time-to-recovery and ability to handle concurrent load.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Mobile-responsive design for tablets and phones

security_controls.requirement: Verify web application is resilient to XSS and that output encoding is used on all UI elements including dashboards and charts.
security_controls.relevance: Mobile/responsive UIs still present attack surface for XSS; encoding and XSS mitigations remain essential across device types.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure mobile UI uses same output encoding and CSP policies as desktop, test touch event handling and avoid exposing debug endpoints on mobile.
security_controls.verification_method: Run XSS tests on mobile/responsive views and validate CSP effectiveness.

security_controls.requirement: Maintain secure configuration of third-party components including those used for mobile/responsive UI frameworks.
security_controls.relevance: Mobile frameworks often rely on third-party libs; this control ensures these are managed and patched to prevent vulnerabilities.
security_controls.integration_tips: Track front-end/framework dependencies, patch vulnerabilities and verify compatibility across devices before deployment.
security_controls.verification_method: Review SCA reports for front-end libs and confirm remediation of identified issues.

security_controls.requirement: Developer security testing and evaluation to ensure applications operate securely across devices.
security_controls.relevance: Encourages testing across devices/platforms to ensure mobile responsiveness does not introduce security regressions.
security_controls.integration_tips: Include mobile/responsive UI in security testing scope, run functional and security tests on major device classes and viewports.
security_controls.verification_method: Review test results from multi-device security tests and confirm fixes for identified issues.

security_controls.requirement: Ensure secure configuration of UI frameworks and third-party components used in dashboards (no insecure libraries).
security_controls.relevance: Ensures responsive UI frameworks are securely configured and free of vulnerable components across mobile and desktop.
security_controls.integration_tips: Audit front-end frameworks, remove unused modules and ensure secure CSP and subresource integrity (SRI) where applicable.
security_controls.verification_method: Check SRI/CSP usage and SCA results for front-end dependencies.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Rate-limiting and abuse prevention for APIs and uploads

security_controls.requirement: Implement rate limiting and quotas on APIs and upload endpoints to protect against abuse and resource exhaustion.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applicable to preventing abuse of APIs and upload endpoints via throttling, quotas and limiting strategies.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement per-user and per-IP quotas, burst rate limiting, global and endpoint-specific thresholds and provide meaningful rejection responses.
security_controls.verification_method: Run automated load tests to verify rate limits trigger and measure enforcement behavior.

security_controls.requirement: Denial of service protection. Protect against resource depletion via throttling and quotas.
security_controls.relevance: Reinforces need for DoS protections via throttling to prevent resource exhaustion from abusive API or upload activity.
security_controls.integration_tips: Deploy DDoS protection services, use connection limits and monitoring to detect abnormal traffic patterns and enforce throttles.
security_controls.verification_method: Simulate abusive traffic patterns and confirm DoS protections mitigate impact.

security_controls.requirement: Capacity requirements and planning shall be performed to ensure availability and performance.
security_controls.relevance: Capacity planning supports rate-limiting policies and ensures quotas are set to maintain availability under load.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define capacity thresholds and adjust quotas according to operational limits; incorporate scaling strategies to handle bursts.
security_controls.verification_method: Review capacity planning docs and verify quotas are aligned with capacity tests.

security_controls.requirement: Remote access. The organization authorizes, monitors, and controls remote access methods including APIs.
security_controls.relevance: Helps ensure API access is controlled and monitored in addition to rate limiting to prevent abuse from remote actors.
security_controls.integration_tips: Monitor API usage, require authentication for sensitive endpoints and combine rate limits with access controls.
security_controls.verification_method: Review access logs and rate-limit enforcement along with monitoring alerts for abuse patterns.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Monitoring, alerting, and vulnerability/patch management processes

security_controls.requirement: Flaw remediation. Identify, report, and correct information system flaws in a timely manner.
security_controls.relevance: Directly targets vulnerability identification and remediation processes for application and infrastructure components.
security_controls.integration_tips: Establish ticket-driven remediation workflows, prioritize vulnerabilities by risk, and track time-to-remediate metrics.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect vulnerability tracking system and verify remediation timelines and evidence of fixes.

security_controls.requirement: Establish monitoring, alerting and patch management processes to detect and remediate vulnerabilities and incidents.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates establishing monitoring/alerting and patch management processes to ensure continuous detection and remediation.
security_controls.integration_tips: Deploy centralized monitoring, configure alerts for critical events, integrate patch management automation and validate patching in staging before production.
security_controls.verification_method: Review monitoring/alert rules, check incident response times and patch rollout records.

security_controls.requirement: Ensure that vulnerabilities are identified and timely remediation occurs.
security_controls.relevance: ISO-level governance for vulnerability management ensuring organizational adherence and recordkeeping.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define vulnerability lifecycle, ownership, SLA for fixes and maintain scheduled scanning and reporting.
security_controls.verification_method: Review vulnerability management metrics, scan schedules and SLA compliance.

security_controls.requirement: Continuous monitoring. Implement ongoing assessment and monitoring to ensure security posture remains acceptable.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates continuous monitoring to detect deviations and support alerting and remediation processes.
security_controls.integration_tips: Integrate telemetry into SIEM, define KPIs for security posture and schedule continuous scans and assessments.
security_controls.verification_method: Review SIEM dashboards, continuous monitoring reports and evidence of action on detected issues.

cross_functional_controls.description: Centralized, tamper-evident logging of authentication, authorization, job lifecycle events, admin actions, file operations and system health; includes integrity protection and retention policies.
applies_to: All requirements (authentication, RBAC, APIs, workers, hardware control, backups, admin panel, uploads, logs, monitoring)
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Implement centralized logging (SIEM), use append-only storage or signed logs, enforce retention/archival policies, ensure logs include user/service identity, timestamps and correlation IDs. Protect logs with access controls and monitor for anomalous patterns.

cross_functional_controls.description: Protect sensitive data, secrets, artifacts and communications using organization-approved cryptographic algorithms and key management.
applies_to: Session tokens, API traffic (WebSockets/SSE), artifact storage, secrets management, backups, worker-to-HPC communication, webhooks and device programming
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Enforce TLS (strong ciphers) for all transport; encrypt storage volumes and sensitive fields; manage keys with a KMS or HSM; apply mutual TLS for service-to-service/device links and rotate keys/secrets regularly.

cross_functional_controls.description: Enforce RBAC, least privilege for users and services, and server-side authorization checks across all APIs, admin UIs, and device controls.
applies_to: RBAC, admin panel, API endpoints, FPGA/HPC access, background workers, artifact downloads, backups
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Implement centralized IAM, map AD groups to roles, enforce server-side checks, require MFA for privileged operations, and run periodic access reviews and entitlement audits.

cross_functional_controls.description: Secure coding practices, SCA/SBOM for dependencies, vulnerability scanning in CI/CD, and secure configuration of frameworks and containers.
applies_to: All web UIs, APIs, containers, provisioning scripts, mobile/responsive code and third-party integrations
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Integrate SCA into CI pipelines, maintain SBOMs, scan and patch dependencies, enforce secure defaults in containers and perform application security testing (DAST/SAST) before release.

cross_functional_controls.control_name: Rate Limiting, Quotas and DoS Protections
cross_functional_controls.description: Protect APIs, upload endpoints and real-time channels from abuse with rate limiting, quotas, and DDoS mitigation strategies.
applies_to: APIs, uploads, real-time updates, build submission endpoints
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Implement per-user / per-IP limits, global quotas, WAF rules and DDoS services; monitor and tune thresholds based on capacity planning and apply graceful degradation policies.
